titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Governor John Stewart Battle Executive records, 1950-1954
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
the Library of Virginia 24504

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Governor John Stewart Battle Executive records, 1950-1954

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Governor John Stewart Battle Executive records, 1950-1954. Accession 24504. State government records, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va 23219

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the Office of the Governor, June and July 1956.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection has been processed using minimal processing standards: the original arrangement has been maintained, the container list is brief and simple, and the records have not been refoldered and fasteners have not been removed.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: John Stewart Battle was born in New Bern, North Carolina on 11 July 1890. He served in the Virginia House of Delegates from 1930-1933, in the Virginia Senate from 1934-1949, and as Governor from 1950-1954. He died in Charlottesville, Va., 9 April 1972.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Executive Papers of Governor John S. Battle are housed in 172 boxes. The collection is arranged into eight (8) series. Series have been designated for: I. Reports on Audits. II. State Government. III. Extraditions. IV. Federal Government. V. General Assembly. VI. General Correspondence. VII. Invitations. VIII. Judicial. These records include applications, appointments, audits, correspondence, executive orders, extraditions, invitations, invoices, minutes, proclamations, recommendations, reports, and speeches. These records document the gubernatorial administration of John S. Battle from 18 January 1950 to 19 January 1954.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into the following series:

scopecontent.p: The Reports on Audits are housed in 45 boxes and are arranged by year and subdivided by locality and state agency.

did.unittitle: Agencies, Alcoholic Beverage Control Board-Lynchburg State College, 1950-1951
Agencies, Manassas High School-Virginia Truck Experiment Station, 1950-1951
Agencies, ABC-Commission of Game and Inland Fisheries, 1952
Agencies, DeJarnette State Sanatorium-Medical College of Virginia, 1952
Agencies, Unemployment Compensation Commission-Virginia State Library, 1953
Agencies, ABC-Dept. of Welfare and Institutions, 1954
Agencies, Police Court-Supreme Court of Appeals, 1954
Agencies, Violations Bureau-Woodrow Wilson Rehabilitation Center, 1954

scopecontent.p: The State Government records are housed in 44 boxes and are arranged alphabetically by agency or subject. Subjects include: Alcoholic Beverage Control Board, Boards, Commissions (including Art Commission and Hampton Roads Sanitation Commission), Virginia Conservation Commission, Virginia Corporation Commission, Education (Advisory Research Committee on School Construction, Superintendent of Public Instruction, and colleges and universities), Governor's Mansion, Grounds and Buildings, Department of Health, Highways, Department of Mental Hygiene and Hospitals (includes mental hospitals), Military Affairs (Adjutant General), Retirement (Virginia Retirement System and Virginia Supplemental Retirement System), State Police, Taxation, Unemployment Compensation Commission, Virginia Ports Authority, Welfare and Institutions (Corrections, Penitentiary, and Parole Board), and Public Welfare.

did.unittitle: Commissions, Advisory Council on the Virginia Economy, 1950
Commissions, Advisory Council on the Virginia Economy, 1951
Commissions, Advisory Council on the Virginia Economy, 1952-1953
Commissions, Elizabeth River Tunnel-Game and Inland Fisheries
Education, Advisory Research Committee on School Construction-Public Schools
Education, Rehabilitation and Adult Education-Woodrow Wilson Rehabilitation Center
Education, Schools, College of William and Mary-Medical College of Virginia
Education, University of Virginia-Mary Washington College
Education, Virginia Military Institute-Virginia Polytechnic Institute
Education, Virginia Polytechnic Institute-Virginia Truck Experiment Station
Mental Hygiene and Hospitals, Dept. of
Mental Hygiene and Hospitals, Hospitals, Central State-Western State
Welfare and Institutions, Board of-Dept. of Welfare and Institutions

scopecontent.p: The Extradition records are housed in 27 boxes and are arranged alphabetically. Following the extradition records is a petition for the Martinsville Seven and records for the removal of political disabilities.
The Federal Government records are housed in 7 boxes and are arranged alphabetically by agency or subject. Subjects include: Army, Civilian Defense, Executive Departments, and Rent.

The General Assembly records are housed in 8 boxes and are arranged by General Assembly session followed by subjects. Records include: notes on bills, Commissions, Virginia Advisory Legislative Council, Redistricting, Reports, and Resignations.

did.unittitle: Transcribing of evidence in criminal cases

scopecontent.p: The General Correspondence are housed in 29 boxes and are arranged alphabetically by subject. Notable subjects include: Civil Rights, Executive Orders, Proclamations, Requests, Southern Governors, Statements, and Taxes.

did.unittitle: Government of the District of Columbia
Letters sent to Heads of Departments, Mimeograph copies
National Capitol Park and Planning Commission
National Employ the Physically Handicapped Week
National Society, Daughters of American Revolution
Northern Virginia Regional Planning and Economic Development Commission
Virginia Council on Health and Medical Care

scopecontent.p: The Invitations are housed in 8 boxes and are arranged chronologically.
The Judicial records are housed in 8 boxes and are arranged by Court.

did.unittitle: Supreme Court of Appeals of Virginia
